Main article: Main account

Main accounts (or mains) are the primary player accounts with no skill or quest restrictions. They typically train all free-to-play skills, which allows them to achieve the highest combat and total levels among all build types. Mains can achieve up to 126 combat level.

In the context of account builds and player-versus-player activities, high level accounts—typically with evenly distributed combat skills—are referred to as mains. As opposed to the combat pures, main accounts train skills such as attack, defence, and prayer past the point of unlocking the best available items and prayers without any restrictions. As these accounts tend to be on the defensive side, their lack of specialization on PvP and lack of focus on damage output leaves them less successful on lower combat levels, where they have to complete with optimised accounts such as the 1 defence pures or rune pures. However, they are the most common high level build, since specialised accounts tend to max out their non-restricted combat skills before reaching the final combat level brackets. Maxed mains are particularly common in PvP combat.

Contents

  • 1 Equipment
  • 2 Training
  • 3 Combat style
  • 4 See also

Equipment[edit | edit source]

Main article: Free-to-play PvP equipment
See also: Free-to-play PvP equipment#Armour with defence requirements, Free-to-play PvP equipment#High defence setups and Rune pure (free-to-play)#Equipment

With no restriction on defence or ranged, main accounts can wear rune armour and full green d'hide armour after getting 40 defence and ranged levels respectively. They also have access to other items with defence requirements such as the gold decorative boots that provide a small strength bonus. Main accounts can use all free-to-play weapons including elemental staves, maple bows, and rune weapons.

For a complete equipment guide, refer to the rune pure and the free-to-play PvP equipment articles. Note that the rune pures at 40 attack and defence can use all free-to-play items that main accounts have access to.

Training[edit | edit source]

Main articles: Free-to-play melee training, Free-to-play Ranged training, and Free-to-play Magic training

With no restrictions on combat skills, these accounts can follow the standard free-to-play combat training methods. In particular, thanks to the high defence levels, main accounts can be trained on aggressive NPCs such as flesh crawlers or giant spiders for long periods of time.

Combat style[edit | edit source]

Main article: Free-to-play PvP techniques

Depending on the used combat styles, in player-versus-player combat main accounts can use the same techniques as ranged-melee hybrids, melee pures, or magic pures. However, due to their defensive capabilities, they can employ much riskier tactics.

Melee fights, often without armour, are very common among maxed mains in the arranged 1-vs-1 duels on PvP worlds.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Free-to-play combat pure guide
  • Free-to-play account builds
  • Free-to-play Ironman guide
  • Rune pure (free-to-play)

{{main|Main account}}

'''Main accounts''' (or '''mains''') are the primary player accounts with no skill or quest restrictions. They typically train all [[free-to-play]] skills, which allows them to achieve the highest [[Combat level|combat]] and [[Total level|total]] levels among all build types. '''Mains''' can achieve up to 126 combat level.

In the context of [[Free-to-play account builds|account builds]] and [[player-versus-player]] activities, high level accounts—typically with evenly distributed combat skills—are referred to as '''mains'''. As opposed to the [[Free-to-play combat pure guide|combat pures]], '''main accounts''' train skills such as [[attack]], [[defence]], and [[prayer]] past the point of unlocking the best available items and prayers without any restrictions. As these accounts tend to be on the defensive side, their lack of specialization on [[PvP]] and lack of focus on damage output leaves them less successful on lower combat levels, where they have to complete with optimised accounts such as the [[One-defence pure (free-to-play)|1 defence pures]] or [[Rune pure (free-to-play)|rune pures]]. However, they are the most common high level build, since specialised accounts tend to max out their non-restricted combat skills before reaching the final [[combat level]] brackets. Maxed '''mains''' are particularly common in [[PvP]] combat.

==Equipment==

{{main|Free-to-play PvP equipment}}
{{see also|Free-to-play PvP equipment#Armour with defence requirements|Free-to-play PvP equipment#High defence setups|Rune pure (free-to-play)#Equipment}}

With no restriction on [[defence]] or [[ranged]], '''main accounts''' can wear [[rune armour]] and full [[green d'hide armour]] after getting 40 [[defence]] and [[ranged]] levels respectively. They also have access to other items with [[defence]] requirements such as the [[Decorative boots (gold)|gold decorative boots]] that provide a small strength bonus. '''Main accounts''' can use all [[free-to-play]] weapons including [[elemental staves]], [[Maple shortbow|maple bows]], and [[rune weapons]].

For a complete equipment guide, refer to the [[Rune pure (free-to-play)#Equipment|rune pure]] and the [[free-to-play PvP equipment]] articles. Note that the rune pures at 40 [[attack]] and [[defence]] can use all [[free-to-play]] items that '''main accounts''' have access to.

==Training==

{{main|Free-to-play melee training|Free-to-play Ranged training|Free-to-play Magic training}}

With no restrictions on combat skills, these accounts can follow the standard [[free-to-play]] combat training methods. In particular, thanks to the high [[defence]] levels, '''main accounts''' can be trained on [[aggressive]] [[NPC]]s such as [[flesh crawler]]s or [[giant spider]]s for long periods of time.

==Combat style==

{{main|Free-to-play PvP techniques}}

Depending on the used combat styles, in [[player-versus-player]] combat '''main accounts''' can use the same techniques as [[Ranged-melee hybrid (free-to-play)#Combat style|ranged-melee hybrids]], [[Melee pure (free-to-play)#Combat style|melee pures]], or [[Magic pure (free-to-play)#Combat style|magic pures]]. However, due to their defensive capabilities, they can employ much riskier tactics.

Melee fights, often without armour, are very common among maxed '''mains''' in the arranged 1-vs-1 duels on [[PvP world]]s.
